Death sentence; six counts of first degree murder and an imposed death sentence for each of the six convictions, as well as three counts of attempted first degree murder carrying three consecutive 40-year prison sentences. In 2016, Griego was sentenced to the custody of New Mexico Children, Youth, and Families Department until his 21st birthday. 11 days before he was supposed to be released, the District Attorney's Office's filed an appeal for him to go back to a judge for another amenability hearing. Judge found the 22 year old is not amenable to treatment and should be tried as an adult. He now faces up to 120 years in prison but his district attorney says he may get probation and timed served as prison would reverse the effects of the treatment he's recieved over the past six years in custody.

Life sentence; first trial in 2011, jury found him guilty on robbery and conspiracy to commit arson charges but could not reach a verdict on any of the murder counts, for which a judge gave him a life sentence due to his extensive criminal history. Appealed this decision and at a second trial in 2012 was found guilty on four charges of murder and four counts of felony murder and was sentenced to 300 years in prison (75 years/count). This conviction was appealed and held up by a three judge appellate, with one judge dissenting that Terrell's charges should be overturned because he was not given a fair trial due to testimonial admissions and failure to dismiss biased jurors.

notes: Vincent Smothers admitted to killing a dozen victims, including these four, as part of his role as a hitman. However, he was not formally convicted for this crime, but was for others. He is serving 52 year prison sentence and eligible for parole in 2060.  Smothers said he and Ernest “Nemo” Davis were responsible for the killings, but Davontae Sanford, 14 years old at the time of the homicide, was convicted after giving a confession to police that was rife with inaccuracies, in contrast to Smothers’ accurate account. Sanford had been convicted of this crime, but was exonerated in 2016 and released from custody.
